titles.title: Condemning the visit of Louis Farrakhan to Libya, Iran, and Iraq as well as certain statements he made during those visits, and urging the President to take appropriate action to determine if such visits, statements, and actions resulting from agreements or understandings reached during these visits violate Federal law.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on International Relations.
Referred to the Subcommittee on International Operations and Human Rights.

bill.summary: 2/27/1996--Introduced. Condemns: (1) the visit of Louis Farrakhan to Libya, Iran, and Iraq; and (2) his statements made during those visits which are derogatory of U.S. foreign policy and which support the governments of these countries (all of which are on the list of countries which support terrorism). Calls upon the President to direct appropriate Government agencies to determine if Farrakhan violated any Federal laws by such visits or statements or in actions resulting from agreements or understandings reached during these visits and to prosecute any such violations.
